legal_basis: Sections 7 and 15 of the Charter of Rights and Freedoms
charter_rights: Section 7 - life, liberty, security of the person
cause_of_action: Amendment to Immigration Act limiting appeals
result_of_case: Court held Section 83 does not contravene Sections 7 or 15 of the Charter

legal_basis: Section 7 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
charter_rights: life, liberty, and security of the person in accordance with fundamental justice
decision_reasoning: Charter does not guarantee a right to appeal
judicial review adequately protects Section 7 rights
cause_of_action: Amendments to the Immigration Act changed appeals to judicial reviews
result_of_case: transitional provisions do not violate Section 7 of the Charter

decision_reasoning: no credible evidence supporting his fear of persecution

result_details: Bristol-Myers can fully participate. Motions by other innovator companies and Rx&D to intervene are dismissed.

legal_basis: subsection 39(4) of the Income Tax Act
cause_of_action: Dispute over tax treatment of investment gains realized by the plaintiff
procedure_followed: Appeal process involving examination of discovery admissions, trial proceedings, and judicial interpretation of applicable tax laws
decision_reasoning: gains were from adventures in the nature of trade
result_of_case: Plaintiff succeeded; gains treated as capital gains, and reassessment invalidated
application_details: plaintiff claimed capital gains on investment dispositions
evidence_presented: discovery admitted by CCRA auditor Mr. Ling
decision_made: The plaintiff's gains were determined to be capital gains
